class_notes:
Full Title: Performance on Demand: How Our Brains and Bodies Learn to Improvise.
Improvisation is a familiar feature of musical, comedic, and dance performances.  It also plays an important role in social interaction. The act of improvisation occupies a liminal space between deliberate action, established habit, and unplanned spontaneity.  This sidecar will explore the musicological, psychological, neurological, sociological, and philosophical dimensions of improvisation.
course_description: A side-car course brings together a subset of students from two courses that overlap in methodologies, topics, etc., to create a short interdisciplinary course that runs simultaneously with its two sponsoring courses. One credit, S/U only. Schedule and format arranged by sponsoring professors.
